[10]If he's gonna do it, you know, be seen talking in public with someone else, he should show some respect.  He should show me the respect, at least, to be seen with someone pretty. Someone cool. Someone who counts. Amy or you, you know, ate. Instead, it's Its. And I feel... 
[11]That's right. I wish there was something I could do to make him come to his senses. On MARK's face, a slow, insidious grin that seems to spread into eternity appears. 
[12]What? 
[13]  
[14] Perfect. We have the homefield advantage. 
[15]Oh, wow, that sucks. Further proof Carlin guys are gravy sucking pigs. 
[16]Need a ride? 
[17]Wouldn't miss it. Hop in. As he gets into her car, TRACY has one hand on the wheel, the other hanging out her window. She drops something as JESSE closes the door. REVEAL a CAN of red spray paint TRACY dropped onto the parking lot's tarmac. 
[18]Just a quick stop at my house, want to change my outfit. Her car pulls off... 
[19]He told me he was thinking of me when he fucked you. 97. Seeing MARK laughing, JESSE realizes what's going on. 
[20]  
[21]Screw that, get the shotguns! Shaking, freaked out, they gather weapons.
dialogues.Arnie:
[1]Hi there gruesome twosome, how 'bout a threesome? 
[2] Love is fifteen seconds of squishing noises. Unquote. Johnny Rotten. Scattered laughs. JESSE overhears TRACY as she nods at RACHEL, whispers to AMY... 
[3]Food! 
[4]What'd he want? 
[5]What'd you say? 
[6]Pardon me, but is hanging out with jockboy such a hot idea? I mean, 41. 
[7]I heard he's dating Tracy Campbell, who is giving you the look of a thousand deaths right now. RACHEL casually turns to take in TRACY, then turns away. Her heart sinks. 
[8]Duh. 
[9]  
[10]Hey, Monica, can ya get us into the party? 
[11]Man, we are missing one killer party.
dialogues.Boyd:
[1]  
[2] Daytime, yes; nighttime, no. We've been over this ground. I only brought him in this morning. No juice? 
[3] You watch that voice in this house. While you're here, you'll respect her as your mother, and treat her as such. 
[4]Come back here, mutt. Aw, good riddance. And he closes the gate. 
[5]Your dog got out. Better get'im. 
[6]What's wrong? 
[7]You were out all night. RACHEL nods, defiantly. He walks over to her and, without warning, slaps her. 
[8]You're grounded. No school today. You don't move from this room. He turns on his heel, walks out. The dog looks as stricken as she does.
dialogues.Kelton:
[1]  
[2]Hi. He holds out Lisa's PHOTO STUB. RACHEL takes it, sees the name, her eyes widen. 
[3]"For a moment, I thought someone was actually seeing me. But it was all a lie..." 
[4]"Eric lied when he said I was special. And I guess I was lying to myself when I believed him." He folds the note. 
[5]You recognize this boy? 
[6]What do you think? 
[7]Nothing illegal about breaking a girl's heart. 
[8]That's a stretch. 
[9]All right. I'll look into it. 
[10]So, you're saying you never met or talked to Lisa Parker? 
[11]Save it, Lou. Sue Snell told me there were other girls-- 
[12]Youthful transgressions? A girl killed herself. The door opens and the town's MAYOR walks in, grey-haired, distinguished, with an air of authority. 
[13]
